company.name: IDmission LLC
company.business_description: IDmission LLC offers a cloud-based technology platform to help business clients engage with their customers.

case_info.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act

complaint.factual_background: IDmission LLC, a cloud-based technology platform provider, claimed on its website that it was a certified participant in the EU-U.S. Privacy Shield framework, which governs the lawful transfer of personal data from the EU to the United States. Although Respondent initiated an application to the Department of Commerce for Privacy Shield certification in October 2017, it never completed the required steps to become a certified participant. Commerce warned IDmission to remove its Privacy Shield claims until certification was complete, but the company failed to do so. By continuing to display these claims at least through June 2018, IDmission deceived consumers and business clients about the legal basis for its handling of EU personal data.

representations_made.description: Claimed to comply with the EU-U.S. Privacy Shield Framework and to have certified to the Department of Commerce that it adheres to Privacy Shield Principles
representations_made.quoted_text: IDmission, LLC complies with the EU-U.S. Privacy Shield Framework as set forth by the U.S. Department of Commerce regarding the collection, use, and retention of personal information transferred from the European Union to the United States. IDmission has certified to the Department of Commerce that it adheres to the Privacy Shield Principles. If there is any conflict between the terms in this privacy policy and the Privacy Shield Principles, the Privacy Shield Principles shall govern. To learn more about the Privacy Shield program, and to view our certification, please visit https://www.privacyshield.gov/

counts.title: Privacy Shield Misrepresentation
counts.representation: Respondent represents, directly or indirectly, expressly or by implication, that it is a participant in the EU-U.S. Privacy Shield framework.
counts.fact: Although Respondent initiated an application to Commerce for Privacy Shield certification, it did not complete the steps necessary to participate in the EU-U.S. Privacy Shield framework.
counts.conclusion: Therefore, the representation set forth in Paragraph 11 is false or misleading.

definitions.Respondent: IDmission LLC, a corporation, and its successors and assigns.

provisions.title: Prohibition Against Misrepresentations About Participation in Privacy or Security Programs
provisions.summary: Respondent must not misrepresent, expressly or by implication, the extent to which it participates in, is certified by, or complies with any government or self-regulatory privacy or security program, including the EU-U.S. and Swiss-U.S. Privacy Shield frameworks.

requirements.description: Must not misrepresent membership, certification, endorsement, or participation in any privacy or security program sponsored by a government or self-regulatory/standard-setting organization, including but not limited to the EU-U.S. Privacy Shield and Swiss-U.S. Privacy Shield frameworks
requirements.quoted_text: IT IS ORDERED that Respondent and its officers, agents, employees, and attorneys, and all other persons in active concert or participation with any of them, who receive actual notice of this Order, whether acting directly or indirectly, in connection with the advertising, marketing, promotion, offering for sale, or sale of any product or service must not misrepresent in any manner, expressly or by implication, the extent to which Respondent is a member of, adheres to, complies with, is certified by, is endorsed by, or otherwise participates in any privacy or security program sponsored by a government or any self-regulatory or standard-setting organization, including but not limited to the EU-U.S. Privacy Shield framework and the Swiss- U.S. Privacy Shield framework.

provisions.title: Acknowledgments of the Order
provisions.summary: Respondent must acknowledge receipt of the Order itself, deliver copies to relevant personnel and business successors for 20 years, and obtain signed acknowledgments from all recipients.

requirements.description: Within 10 days after the effective date, Respondent must submit to the Commission an acknowledgment of receipt of this Order
requirements.quoted_text: A. Respondent, within ten (10) days after the effective date of this Order, must submit to the Commission an acknowledgment of receipt of this Order.

requirements.description: For 20 years after issuance, Respondent must deliver a copy of this Order to all principals, officers, directors, LLC managers and members, employees with managerial responsibilities related to the Order's subject matter, agents and representatives participating in related conduct, and any business entity resulting from a structural change; delivery must occur within 10 days for current personnel, and before assuming responsibilities for all others
requirements.quoted_text: B. For twenty (20) years after the issuance date of this Order, Respondent must deliver a copy of this Order to: (1) all principals, officers, directors, and LLC managers and members; (2) all employees having managerial responsibilities for conduct related to the subject matter of the Order and all agents and representatives who participate in conduct related to the subject matter of the Order; and (3) any business entity resulting from any Page 2 of 5 change in structure as set forth in the Provision titled Compliance Report and Notices. Delivery must occur within ten (10) days after the effective date of this Order for current personnel. For all others, delivery must occur before they assume their responsibilities.

requirements.description: From each individual or entity to which a copy of the Order was delivered, Respondent must obtain a signed and dated acknowledgment of receipt within 30 days
requirements.quoted_text: C. From each individual or entity to which Respondent delivered a copy of this Order, Respondent must obtain, within thirty (30) days, a signed and dated acknowledgment of receipt of this Order.

provisions.title: Compliance Report and Notices
provisions.summary: Respondent must submit an initial sworn compliance report within 60 days, and thereafter submit timely sworn notices of changes in contact points, business structure, or bankruptcy proceedings.

requirements.description: Within 60 days of the issuance date, submit a sworn compliance report identifying designated contact information, all business names and addresses, description of each business's activities, detailed compliance status for each Order provision, and copies of all acknowledgments obtained
requirements.quoted_text: A. Sixty (60) days after the issuance date of this Order, Respondent must submit a compliance report, sworn under penalty of perjury, in which Respondent must: (a) identify the primary physical, postal, and email address and telephone number, as designated points of contact, which representatives of the Commission, may use to communicate with Respondent; (b) identify all of Respondent’s businesses by all of their names, telephone numbers, and physical, postal, email, and Internet addresses; (c) describe the activities of each business; (d) describe in detail whether and how Respondent is in compliance with each Provision of this Order; and (e) provide a copy of each Acknowledgment of the Order obtained pursuant to this Order, unless previously submitted to the Commission.

requirements.description: Submit a sworn compliance notice within 14 days of any change in a designated point of contact or in the structure of Respondent or any entity it owns or controls that may affect compliance obligations, including creation, merger, sale, or dissolution of the entity or any subsidiary, parent, or affiliate
requirements.quoted_text: B. Respondent must submit a compliance notice, sworn under penalty of perjury, within fourteen (14) days of any change in the following: (1) any designated point of contact; or (2) the structure of Respondent or any entity that Respondent has any ownership interest in or controls directly or indirectly that may affect compliance obligations arising under this Order, including: creation, merger, sale, or dissolution of the entity or any subsidiary, parent, or affiliate that engages in any acts or practices subject to this Order.

requirements.description: Submit notice of the filing of any bankruptcy petition, insolvency proceeding, or similar proceeding by or against Respondent within 14 days of its filing
requirements.quoted_text: C. Respondent must submit notice of the filing of any bankruptcy petition, insolvency proceeding, or similar proceeding by or against Respondent within fourteen (14) days of its filing.

requirements.description: Any sworn submission to the Commission must be true and accurate, comply with 28 U.S.C. § 1746, include the declaration language, date, signatory's full name, title (if applicable), and signature
requirements.quoted_text: D. Any submission to the Commission required by this Order to be sworn under penalty of perjury must be true and accurate and comply with 28 U.S.C. § 1746, such as by concluding: “I declare under penalty of perjury under the laws of the United States of America that the foregoing is true and correct. Executed on: _____” and supplying the date, signatory’s full name, title (if applicable), and signature.

requirements.description: Unless otherwise directed in writing, all submissions must be emailed to Debrief@ftc.gov or sent by overnight courier (not USPS) to the Associate Director of Enforcement, Bureau of Consumer Protection, FTC, 600 Pennsylvania Avenue, N.W., Washington, D.C. 20580; subject line must begin: In re IDmission LLC, FTC File No. 1823150
requirements.quoted_text: E. Unless otherwise directed by a Commission representative in writing, all submissions to the Commission pursuant to this Order must be emailed to Debrief@ftc.gov or sent by overnight courier (not the U.S. Postal Service) to: Associate Director of Enforcement, Bureau of Consumer Protection, Federal Trade Commission, 600 Pennsylvania Avenue, N.W., Washington, D.C. 20580. The subject line must begin: In re IDmission LLC, FTC File No. 1823150.

provisions.title: Recordkeeping
provisions.summary: Respondent must create specified records for 20 years after issuance and retain each record for 5 years, covering financial, personnel, compliance, and advertising materials.

requirements.description: Create and retain accounting records showing revenues from all goods or services sold, for 20 years (retaining each record for 5 years)
requirements.quoted_text: IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that Respondent must create certain records for twenty (20) years after the issuance date of the Order, and retain each such record for five (5) years. Specifically, Respondent must create and retain the following records: A. accounting records showing the revenues from all goods or services sold;

requirements.description: Create and retain personnel records showing each service provider's name, addresses, telephone numbers, job title or position, dates of service, and reason for termination (if applicable)
requirements.quoted_text: B. personnel records showing, for each person providing services, whether as an employee or otherwise, that person’s: name; addresses; telephone numbers; job title or position; dates of service; and (if applicable) the reason for termination;

requirements.description: Create and retain all records necessary to demonstrate full compliance with each provision of this Order, including all submissions to the Commission
requirements.quoted_text: C. all records necessary to demonstrate full compliance with each provision of this Order, including all submissions to the Commission; and

requirements.description: Create and retain a copy of each unique advertisement or other marketing material making a representation subject to this Order, and all materials relied upon in making the representation
requirements.quoted_text: D. a copy of each unique advertisement or other marketing material making a representation subject to this Order, and all materials that were relied upon in making the representation.

provisions.title: Compliance Monitoring
provisions.summary: The Commission is authorized to monitor Respondent's compliance through information requests, direct communications, interviews of affiliated persons, and undercover investigations.

requirements.description: Within 10 days of receipt of a written request from a Commission representative, Respondent must submit additional compliance reports or other requested information (sworn under penalty of perjury) and produce records for inspection and copying
requirements.quoted_text: A. Within ten (10) days of receipt of a written request from a representative of the Commission, Respondent must: submit additional compliance reports or other requested information, which must be sworn under penalty of perjury, and produce records for inspection and copying.

requirements.description: Respondent must permit Commission representatives to communicate directly with Respondent and to interview anyone affiliated with Respondent who has agreed to such an interview; the interviewee may have counsel present
requirements.quoted_text: B. For matters concerning this Order, representatives of the Commission are authorized to communicate directly with Respondent. Respondent must permit representatives of the Commission to interview anyone affiliated with Respondent who has agreed to such an interview. The interviewee may have counsel present.

requirements.description: The Commission may use all other lawful means, including posing as consumers, suppliers, or other individuals or entities, without identification or prior notice; nothing in this Order limits the Commission's lawful use of compulsory process under Sections 9 and 20 of the FTC Act
requirements.quoted_text: C. The Commission may use all other lawful means, including posing through its representatives as consumers, suppliers, or other individuals or entities, to Respondent or any individual or entity affiliated with Respondent, without the necessity of identification Page 4 of 5 or prior notice. Nothing in this Order limits the Commission’s lawful use of compulsory process, pursuant to Sections 9 and 20 of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 49, 57b-1.

provisions.title: Order Effective Dates
provisions.summary: The Order is effective upon publication on the FTC website and terminates on November 15, 2038, or 20 years from the most recent date the U.S. or Commission files a complaint alleging any Order violation in federal court, whichever is later, subject to specified exceptions.

requirements.description: Order is final and effective upon publication on the Commission's website (ftc.gov) as a final order
requirements.quoted_text: IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that this Order is final and effective upon the date of its publication on the Commission’s website (ftc.gov) as a final order. This Order will terminate on

requirements.description: Order terminates on November 15, 2038, or 20 years from the most recent date the U.S. or Commission files a complaint alleging any violation of the Order in federal court, whichever comes later, subject to listed exceptions for shorter-term provisions, non-named respondents, and post-termination filings
requirements.quoted_text: publication on the Commission’s website (ftc.gov) as a final order. This Order will terminate on November 15, 2038, or twenty (20) years from the most recent date that the United States or the Commission files a complaint (with or without an accompanying settlement) in federal court alleging any violation of the Order, whichever comes later; provided, however, that the filing of such a complaint will not affect the duration of: A. any Provision in this Order that terminates in less than twenty (20) years; B. this Order’s application to any respondent that is not named as a defendant in such complaint; and C. this Order if such complaint is filed after the order has terminated pursuant to this Provision. Provided, further, that if such complaint is dismissed or a federal court rules that Respondent did not violate any provision of the Order, and the dismissal or ruling is either not appealed or upheld on appeal, then the Order will terminate according to this Provision as though the complaint had never been filed, except that the Order will not terminate between the date such complaint is filed and the later of the deadline for appealing such dismissal or ruling and the date such dismissal or ruling is upheld on appeal.

duration.termination_text: This Order will terminate on November 15, 2038, or twenty (20) years from the most recent date that the United States or the Commission files a complaint (with or without an accompanying settlement) in federal court alleging any violation of the Order, whichever comes later; provided, however, that the filing of such a complaint will not affect the duration of: A. any Provision in this Order that terminates in less than twenty (20) years; B. this Order's application to any respondent that is not named as a defendant in such complaint; and C. this Order if such complaint is filed after the order has terminated pursuant to this Provision.
